##100-step pavilion during the epidemic: Suddenly enter the unexpected life

Micro Signal, Peopleweekly

Feature description, portrait of the Times.

Huang Xin, who lives in Wenxinyuan, is in distress. Her husband, suspected of new coronary pneumonia, had a high fever for ten days and was unable to eat. Because of illness, the husband is a bit passive, Moan, although the test has not been diagnosed, but he felt that he is basically a new coronary pneumonia. Huang Xin dare not say to outsiders, colleagues chat up, she also dare not make a sound. "You have this disease in your family, people will have ideas, it's scary. I don't think it's necessary to say, what you say, no one can help you, right? Some have to bear it on their own. "

This article first appeared in the 2020 issue of southern people's weekly
By Wei Yi, Chen Yang, Meng Yiyi, Sun Lingyu
Intern reporter, Nie Yangxin
Editor Zhou Jianping rwzkjpz@163. Com
The full text is about 12,952 and takes about 28 minutes to peruse

Huang Xin, who lives in Wenxinyuan, is in distress. Her husband, suspected of new coronary pneumonia, had a high fever for ten days and was unable to eat. Because of illness, the husband is a bit passive, Moan, although the test has not been diagnosed, but he felt that he is basically a new coronary pneumonia. Huang Xin dare not say to outsiders, colleagues chat up, she also dare not make a sound. "You have this disease in your family, people will have ideas, it's scary. I don't think it's necessary to say, what you say, no one can help you, right? Some have to bear it on their own. "

This article first appeared in the 2020 issue of southern people's weekly

By Wei Yi, Chen Yang, Meng Yiyi, Sun Lingyu

Intern reporter, Nie Yangxin

Editor Zhou Jianping rwzkjpz@163. Com

The full text is about 12,952 and takes about 28 minutes to peruse

On Feb. 17, volunteers in a gated community in Wuhan controlled the flow of people into and out of the street

10,000 dinners

On January 18,2020, just after 8:00 a.m. , Gao Hui (not her real name) , a 79-year-old resident of Baibuting Anju Yuan, left for a banquet. Tens of thousands of dishes will be displayed at the community center. She was wearing a 17-year-old red sweatshirt. Seventeen years ago, she made a dish with her neighbor sister from across the hall, and named it "love in the neighborhood. ". Sometimes she would think of the older sister who had moved away. She's a little nostalgic.

The ingredients for the 10,000 family feasts come from nearby supermarkets or vegetable stalls, most of which are purchased and cooked by the elderly. Shopping online is new for them, few of whom use wechat. Lu, who previously worked in a physical supermarket, saw the potential of fresh e-commerce and moved to a fresh e-commerce platform in July 2019 as a regional manager for Hankou, responsible for eight stations, including the area around the Baibu pavilion. It's almost lunar new year, and he's scheduled to return to his hometown of Wuxi, Jiangsu Province, for the New Year twenty-nine.

Home for Sichuan Leshan You er (not his real name) in early January hurried back to the home, and relatives stayed a week, is ahead of the New Year. You Er opened a community home-cooked restaurant near the Baibu pavilion. Restaurants used to stay open on New Year's. Reservations for 2020 are also hot, from the 30th to the 10th, the first floor nine tables, the second floor ten tables, plus five private rooms, a total of more than 20 tables, almost full. Nearly half of the staff did not go home to prepare the kitchen, to meet this rich year.

Huang Xin (not his real name) lives in Baibu Pavilion Warm Garden. Her father-in-law used to contribute a dish to the banquets, but this year he did not. At the moment, ten thousand banquet venue, more people up, playing three layers outside the three layer dragon lantern. Huang Xin stood at the top, watching the crowd. Opposite the banquet, across the road, is the singing platform, people noise. In front of the rows of tables were beads, grasshoppers and couplets.

The other day, Huang's son was traveling to a competition, and his husband took him from the Baibu Pavilion to the Hankou Railway Station, via the south China Seafood Market. Husband's not wearing a mask.

At about the same time, Mei Hong, a teacher in the school of Sociology at Wuhan University, went to the Hankou station to pick up children returning from Beijing for the Lunar New Year. Wuhan is foggy in winter, she is more concerned about the mask is a must for winter. In addition to the New Year's Day around the news of the epidemic, she is more attention. But at this time in Wuhan taxi, the driver did not wear a mask. Shifu was surprised to see her wearing a mask. She reminded the master. Master smiled: Human Life in God. In Hankou Railway Station, Mei Hong asked the police at the guard post how to get to the underground exit, and the police who answered her did not wear masks.

Before and after the banquet, Sun Xiang (not his real name) , a policeman at the Baibu Pavilion Police Station, was on duty as usual. "I've been here for years, chatting and eating at countless houses, " he said, knowing the history of banquets. "At first it was a hundred-family feast, then a thousand-family feast, and now it's a ten-thousand-family feast. "

Rachel (not her real name)'s parents live in the park. She doesn't live there. It's a 20-minute drive from her place to the kiosk. Parents live in affordable housing. She lived in the pavilion for more than 10 years before her marriage in 2016. The Community of Baibu Pavilion has been published as a national model community.

Back in the day, this was a backwater covered in mud. For many people in Wuhan, it is a "remote and unfamiliar" place. The Baibu pavilion community is located at the southern end of the largest Houhu residential new area in Wuhan's urban master plan, covering an area of 4 square kilometers. In 20 years, more than 100,000 people have moved in. Here is the national model of civilized community, the national model of harmonious community construction community, has been awarded as the National Advanced Cultural Community, is the first "China Habitat Environment Model Award" of the only community.

Rachel doesn't have any feelings about it. "still OK, little common people live. " Yuexiuyuan door of the ten thousand banquet branch, she only went once.

Seit≈ç (not his real name) is a tenant of Babu pavilion. He lives in Wenhui Garden. She works in interior design. It's been five or six years since I moved to the boardwalk. She lives with her parents. She's never been to a family dinner. "parents don't like to join in the fun. Every year in our community, we have one dish per family. The community will send people to each family to deliver a plate. " In Chengdong's impression, one year, her mother made a Mandarin Fish and sent it to the family banquet. For some reason this year, the community didn't send plates.

Rong Min (not her real name) used to live in Wuchang. Four months ago, she gave birth and moved to the garden. This is the old neighborhood of Baibu pavilion. Her parents-in-law bought the House 8 years ago. They also live nearby, so they can take care of their grandchildren. BREAST-FEEDING RONGMIN has been concerned about the news of the outbreak. On Dec. 30,2019, a nurse in a wechat group told her to wear a mask and wash her hands frequently.

"The residents of the Baibu pavilion are mostly elderly people, and usually see people over 40 years old, " said Rong Min. The participants of ten thousand family banquets are mostly old people, and young people generally don't care too much about them.

There is no lack of enthusiasm for family banquets. Gao Hui is one of them. She went to the venue to help in the morning, shopping home at noon, and again in the afternoon, and then returned home at 5 pm. "A very happy thing, " Gao Hui said. "I like to make friends, to meddle in other people's affairs, and to help others. "

In 2000, as one of the first residents to move into the pavilion, Gao Hui and her husband moved into Anju Yuan. At the end of that year, Baibu Pavilion hosted the first Baibu banquet, with only 50 dishes. "A person hair bowl and chopsticks, can taste. " Because feel the new community green good, Gao Hui made a dish, called "Full Garden Spring. ". She is good at creating new dishes. Every year since then, she's been to a hundred-course dinner. Three years later, the 100-family dinner was expanded to a thousand-family dinner. What she did that year was "love in the neighborhood" . In 2009, the thousand-family banquet was expanded to a thousand-family banquet, with 8,146 dishes, making it the "most-exhibited banquet" in the Guinness World Records. "actually, there were 13,000 dishes that year, but many of them missed the 12:00 noon delivery deadline, not counting, " Gao said, remembering the banquets.

Mei Hong did community work in the School of Sociology of Wuhan University, and went to Baibu pavilion to do research. Here every year has the civil affairs department to take the lead to hold the community work training class, every year has run many. "The Baibu pavilion is a model community created by real estate groups and a new type of community built under the party-centred model. "It is a typical case in the process of the transition from the unit system to the community system, but it is not easily replicable, " Mei said, "The Wanjiayan is the community cultural tradition of the Baibu Pavilion, and at that time it was intended to make a difference through community culture. "

When Gao Hui's wife died seven years ago, she became an empty Nester. For Gao Hui, attending a family dinner is a big event of the year. As early as November, she began to prepare, design a number of programs, each time done, then take a picture, pass to close acquaintances, for advice, modify several times, finally shaped.

On Jan. 18, the feast began, as Gao held out her dish -- Tofu topped with a heart shaped mold, surrounded by five heart shaped boxes filled with pomegranates that read, I want to go. On the left is a jar of candy, and on the right are two old people. Gao Hui calls this dish "the happy canteen" .

The "happy canteen" refers to the community canteen for the elderly opened last year. "I live alone, and doing it at home doesn't mean I can't do it, " she said. "It's always left over if I do it too much, and I can't do it without nutrition. I think it's great that there's a cafeteria in the neighborhood. Sometimes a meat-and-vegetable soup, sometimes a meat-and-two-and-vegetable soup, the elderly appetite,"Gao Hui said.

Ten Thousand Family Banquet, "happy canteen" was named "the best creative award" .

On January 18, Wuhan Baibu Pavilion Community held a "Ten thousand family banquet" activity

Photograph by Xiao Yijiu, Xinhua news agency

After the city was sealed,

On the train from Wuhan to Jingmen on January 21, Mei Hong paid a little money and got into the dining car with her family. It's more roomy. It keeps the virus out. She and her family are on their way to Jingmen for the New Year. In the dining car, except for two tourists from Jiangsu and Zhejiang, everyone wore masks. The night before, Zhong Nanshan had been on the news, saying that the virus had spread from person to person. In the dining car, the conductor didn't wear a mask, saying it would cause panic. Mei Hong saw the news that the hundred-step Pavilion banquet was still going on, just as she had seen it for the past twenty years.

Huang Xin, who lives in the pavilion, does not care much about the people around him. "every one of us is at home, who knows what kind of people live there, and we don't keep in touch with each other. We just go out and close the door when we come in. "

Huang Xin originally lived in the street, the old house demolition, her family got demolition money. If you buy a house in the center of the city, it will be smaller. It's too crowded with old people and kids. She moved to Baibu pavilion, living in a 100 square meters of the House.

January 23,100 buting Wenhuiyuan downstairs continuous broadcast loudspeaker notice: Bus Stop at 10 o'clock. Only then did Seit≈ç know: Wuhan was closed. She's a bit of a late bloomer. Many Wuhan residents spent sleepless nights after getting the news at 2 am.

Rong Min, who lives in Wenhuiyuan, watches the news and has a strong sense of precaution. He has prepared some meat and vegetables before, but the variety is limited. For a whole week, her family ate boiled pork balls with cabbage for every meal. Or braise potatoes, carrots and meat. Four days ago, we ran out of food and didn't go to the supermarket. Every night at 10 o'clock on the Internet to grab food, "10 seconds to grab up all. "

Once a week, Rachel brought food to her parents who lived in the pavilion. Today, the community is called Florida. From the young to the middle aged to the old, she became more and more uniformly concerned than ever before. Out of concern for the outbreak, no one wanted to go out. "But what about eating? " Said Rachel.

A lot of people need food. The community helps with the distribution. It's not gonNA be enough. That's Rachel's concern. In the online shopping, can only be delivered to the community gate, and the need for organizers. She was worried about her parents going out to get food. "My mom is not well. I'm afraid my dad will bring back the virus. They're certainly not as well protected as we are. ". Her father took it back and disinfected it.

Lu Jiajun canceled his plans to return to Wuxi for the New Year after he learned of the impending closure of the city. Some of his colleagues immediately drove out of Wuhan. Some of his remaining colleagues had only been on the job for two or three months, and he wasn't comfortable with it, so he chose to stay.

Years ago, he you (not his real name) finished hoarding food and materials at home, afraid of being infected with the virus. After half a month of isolation, she was still worried about alcohol, masks, goggles and food. This year the winter weather in Wuhan is abnormal, rainy, warmer than usual, these days and rain. With high humidity, the virus can survive in the air for much longer. To her horror, "there was almost no smell of disinfectant. " The smell was unpleasant, but reassuring at the moment.

A video has gone viral on the Internet, as if the residents of the pavilion took a photo of the disinfecting staff rushing to disinfect the opposite floor, then left for about a minute. Rong Min, who lives in Wenhuiyuan, saw the video. "We are not sure whether the disinfection work is finished or not. We only look at the disinfection photos posted by the grid operators in the wechat group of each building. Sometimes in the background of the photos, there are grandfathers who are not wearing masks chatting downstairs. "

Lao Zhang is the property staff of Baihe Yuan, he also saw the video of Anju Yuan. "that should be a new employee, sometimes I forget too much [ disinfectant ] , if you hit [ disinfectant ] like we do, 89 units per person, sometimes I forget, even if I miss a unit. Every afternoon, we start at 1 and finish at 4 or 5."

Lao Zhang said that the entire community is managed by the same property company, a total of nearly 2,000 employees. His Lily Garden had a dozen security guards, seven or eight janitors and five or six administrators.

Lily Garden is the room handed in on September 28,2003, the old Zhang laid-off that year, saw the recruitment notice, they came to apply for, has been working until now. First responsible for greening, greening contract to other companies, he transferred to do maintenance. Ten years ago, he was promoted to house manager, responsible for the maintenance and management of utilities such as water and electricity. At night, when the street lights in the neighborhood were broken or a pipe was broken, he had to fix it. If water leaked downstairs, he had to coordinate neighborhood disputes.

During the outbreak, the property is mainly responsible for the disinfection of the public areas of the community, including the corridor, downstairs trash cans and the central square and other places, a total of nine people, disinfection twice a day, more than 8 am and 1 pm each time. There are four people in charge of disinfecting the corridor, there are 35 buildings in the community, each building is divided into three or four separate units, there are 118 units, each unit six floors, because it is the old community, there are no elevators.

Starting Feb. 11, Lao Zhang and his colleagues took over the cleaning and disinfection work. "The corridor of the first to sixth floors of the fever building is completely disinfected, and the corridor of the first to third floors of the fever building is not disinfected. " "We have a limited staff, people in their 50s, a bucket of water 32 Jin, no elevator, to two buildings disinfection, the body can not bear, but also can only adhere to. The disinfectant is sent by the company. The ratio of the disinfectant to the water is 50:1 according to the state regulation. The diluted disinfectant has almost no smell, so the residents can not smell it, but that does not mean that we have not sprayed it. At first, they still did not believe that we have to sterilize the photo group, we do not have time to take each unit, only a few photos. I said to the group, you have to believe me, I am also out to be a volunteer, the company had twenty-nine December off, until March, I can rest at home, but now the national crisis, men should come out of Not Scared to Die. I've been coming back to work voluntarily since February 5th, and I've been doing disinfection since the 11th. I spray every day, and when I'm tired, I never think about not doing it. I just wonder how long this epidemic is going to last."

After February 20, new problems have emerged, some owners with the property said, disinfection water played more is not good, will penetrate the surface layer of water pollution. Others leave their rubbish at the door and ask Lao Zhang and his colleagues to take it down. "We could only persuade him that it was OK to take out the rubbish as long as he wore a mask, but some people wouldn't listen and just threw it down the stairs. After that, we still had to clean up. "

Lao Zhang felt powerless, the property to take care of too many things: cleaning, control in and out of the community, help the community to deliver food to the lonely elderly. "there are 1,341 households in the community, and we don't have time to answer all of them, because we have too many things to do, and we have too few people, and we can't do it all. Now we can't hire anyone. Who Will Come? Everyone is afraid to listen to the 100-step pavilion. " The 21 heating units in the community, but some elderly people simply have a fever, not necessarily a new pneumonia, or other symptoms need first aid. "residents were alarmed when they saw the ambulance come in. Word spread, word spread, and property calls were broken. "

Baibu pavilion each residential property charges are different. Liliyuan property fees low, 0.95 yuan a square. "I don't know about other neighborhoods, but compared to the 1.2 yuan per square meter in the Yangtze River New town where I live, it's low. It was 0.55 yuan in 2003, rose to 0.7 yuan on July 1,2008, and adjusted to 0.95 yuan on January 1,2016, until now, lao Zhang blurted out, remember especially clearly.

Lao Zhang's colleagues are old employees who have been on the job for a long time. Another reason for not hiring young people is that wages are so low that when you get more than two thousand yuan a month, the company only pays for Social Security and Medicare. For more than a decade, wages have risen by a hundred or two a year, sometimes by a few tens of dollars. "But I haven't thought about changing my job either, because I can deal with all kinds of people. I have all kinds of people and I've seen a lot of them, which is interesting, " Zhang said.

Sun Xiang's been a cop at the hundred steps for years. He thinks that after a few years here, he can write a book. He also mentioned a family dinner. Baibu pavilion is famous for many years because of banquets, but also because of banquets at the beginning of the epidemic was criticized. Some Baibu pavilion residents feel aggrieved. One of the articles was widely circulated in order to make people more aware of the pavilions. "You can take a look at this, " Sun Xiang wrote during a break. The article was written by a former journalist. He said, ten thousand banquet site less than ten thousand people, restricted to the venue, after the table, only some people can be left to take photos, not to mention thousands, hundreds of people are impossible. The dishes are covered with plastic film and are not eaten on the spot. It's not their fault the people didn't know the outbreak was serious.

It's not every day that Seit≈ç comes downstairs. She sent a map to our correspondent, "The pavilions are too big. There are lots of them. The one I just sent you is across the road from Great road. These pavilions only make up a fifth of the pavilions. The rest of the pavilions are inside the pavilions. The Red area is the oldest hundred step pavilion garden. We're on lake back, across from Great road. It's all new developments. There are more people infected in the red quarter,"Seit≈ç said.

Aoki (not his real name) lives in Baibu Pavilion and Baibu Dragon Court. "The outbreak occurred to now, no one to check my body temperature, some time ago had called to ask, but not every day. " Green Wood is not satisfied with the residential property. She remembers when she was in elementary school and junior high school, the elevators were always broken. "Last summer, there was no ventilation, not even an electric fan, and the summer in Wuhan was very stuffy. My mother was sitting in the elevator with an old man, and the old man felt very uncomfortable and could not breathe. My mother immediately complained, and only later did the building come to install a fan on the elevator. "

In the Aucuba Japonica neighborhood, two of the three gates were closed, and now only one is allowed in or out. When the family had nothing to do, they would stay on the balcony and look down. Sometimes, "I couldn't see a single person walking downstairs all morning. "

"We can do more than just sit and wait, we should do something we can do, " said Mei Hong, who studies community work, "The outbreak is so severe that the owners' Committee, which we don't usually feel, has played a big role in setting up clusters, sending messages, purchasing materials through Wechat and so on. Some people volunteer and work with the community center. Desperate Times call for desperate measures, and it feels like there's a bond between people. Is there anything we ordinary citizens can do? The residents consciously assigned various tasks to a few people. We are like spectators and judges, watching what the property, the owners'committee and the Community Center do."Mei Hong recalls the Wuhan Flood Control in 1998. "This disaster is different. This disaster is special, and it's taboo to have close interactions with people. What else can we do? I'm thinking about it, too. "

On February 18, residents of Qingheju community, a street in the workers'village of Qingshan District, Wuhan, Wuhan, were searched

Photo / Cheng Min

The patient at the Kiosk

Baibu pavilion is a super city complex, residential, commercial housing, affordable housing and low-cost housing. Li Li (not her real name) is a tenant of the Baibu Pavilion low-rent House. At this time, she is staying in the Budget Hotel which serves as an isolation point. "It was really hard, " Li said. "We came to the isolation hotel on February 11. My friend had a high fever on February 12. "

Li's friend did not know exactly where her symptoms began. Li Li, whose mother went to this year's family feast, is the only one of the three without symptoms. More than 20 square meters of space, the three live together as a friend, mother and Lilly.

After the friend developed symptoms, they went to the Community Hospital for treatment. The doctor ordered them to Hankou Hospital for an X-ray and a blood test. As a suspected case, they were then asked to check into a hotel at the quarantine point. At the Quarantine Hotel, Li Li's friend had a high fever and was asked to be taken to hospital. This is a progressive level of isolation.

Li Li once asked for help in the group of Baibu pavilion owners. The message was sent on the morning of February 13 and the friend was taken to hospital in the afternoon. Li Li Li was also infected, but unlike her friends, she did not have a high fever like her friends, talk some breathing, breathing to feel suffocated, sleep at night cold sweat constantly.

At the quarantine point, Li Li was given the Chinese medicine. When my friend was in the community hospital, a doctor gave him some medicine. After her friend was sent away, Li Li took the medicine he left behind. At the hotel, she went to find a bottle of 84 disinfectant to sterilize the room. She's worried about cross-contamination. Her mask is her own. She's been wearing it since she came in. The last thing she wanted was to be rushed to the hospital when her condition got worse.

Transportation is an urgent problem to be solved. Many emergency vehicles give priority to dialysis patients, cancer patients and other critically ill patients. Suspected patients sometimes have to wait because there are "too many" . One Community worker expressed frustration.

Hong Wei (not his real name) of the Baibu pavilion community began to have a fever on January 30. At first he thought it was a cold. He Ate Cephalosporin, Kangtaike, Lianhua qingwen capsule and antipyretic at home. He never got better. His fever persisted, and he felt weak and confused, dyspnea. On Feb. 3, he went to the community Pulen Hospital, where doctors drew blood and performed a CT scan, which revealed a clear lung infection. The doctor concluded that there was a high suspicion of new crown pneumonia and sent him to the Tertiary Level Hospital immediately. How easy is it to get into a top-three hospital? The family contacted several hospitals and were informed that they did not have the authority to issue a residence permit for fever patients and had to queue up for admission through community registration. After contacting 120, I learned that there were more than 400 people waiting in line.

Hong Wei's sister Hong Jun (not her real name) asked for help. Finally, a relative, O, helped them find a bed in the Tongji courthouse. Hong Wei was hospitalized on January 9 and is now in remission.

Hong Wei lives in the chinese-french branch of Tongji Hospital, Beijing is currently sent to the medical team in treatment. Their sister and brother greet each day with Wechat, "brother speak no energy, sometimes back a word, sometimes not back. "

"Now the community has been sealed, before preparing some necessities, today almost food, call the neighborhood committee sent. " Hongjun said. She can't visit her brother in the hospital. Traffic Control is in effect a few miles from the hospital. The younger brother is admitted to hospital hurriedly, take some daily necessities and carry-on clothes, fruit, milk did not take, can not send again, "we can only wait at home. "

Residents chat at the gate of the Baibu Pavilion Community Photo / Our correspondent Yang Nan

Huang Xin, who lives in Wenxinyuan, is in distress. Her husband is suspected of new pneumonia, 10 days of high fever, shortness of breath, inability to eat, vomiting, and general malaise. Because of illness, the husband is a bit passive, Moan, although the test has not been diagnosed, but he felt that he is basically a new coronary pneumonia. Huang Xin dare not say to outsiders, colleagues chat up, she also dare not make a sound. "You have this disease in your family, people will have ideas, it's pretty scary. I don't think it's necessary to say, what you say, other people can't help you, right? Some people have to bear it on their own. "

Not In the hospital that few days, Huang Xin see her husband can not eat rice, sad to shed tears, and dare not cry in front of him, had to wait until the evening, their own quilt crying. "I'm dying, you know? People are dying. "

After her husband got sick, she moved to the living room. At first she slept on the Sofa with her legs stretched out. Then she moved the stool and the quilt fell off. Finally, she took out two boards and put them together to make a bed. She had no one to confide in, and sometimes told her mother that she had to say "fear not. ".

When the husband first had a fever, he needed to go to the hospital for an injection, but they couldn't get in touch with the car. They ended up going to the hospital for a massage. 50,60 bucks a trip, a hundred bucks a day back and forth. Huang Xin remembers that on the fifth day of her husband's fever, when it was raining heavily, they had to go to the hospital to get an injection. "They wouldn't go, they wouldn't say anything, they couldn't, and we came back. We finally contacted the community to arrange a car, but we had trouble getting back from the hospital. " That day, the two of them had to walk to Huang's mother's house, which was relatively nearby. "I was hungry all day and walked for two and a half hours in the rain to get home. "

A few days later, the husband finally checked into the hospital. She remembers the car that brought her husband to hospital -- a car for feverish patients, "it looked like a box, no windows, just a small piece of clear glass through which you could see the back of the driver. "

On the afternoon of February 17, Huang Xin received a phone call from the community and was told that she, as a close contact of a suspected patient with NCP, would go to a hotel to be quarantined. She Sat on the Sofa Thinking for a long time, but decided to go, although the family only left nearly 80-year-old father-in-law and 17-year-old son.

Wuhan Snow That Day, Huang Xin at home daze, Wuhan winter is not often under such heavy snow, "this year is a disaster year, summer, even the trees are hot death. "

A modified police car is parked in front of the Baibu pavilion community. More specifically, it's the Baibu pavilion at the entrance to a neighborhood that's too big and closer to the street in China's administrative territorial entity. A Life Unexpected of snow is really rare. The snowflakes slanted and fell heavily on the car. The back door of the police car and the door of the cab were both open, which was being disinfected and ventilated after the patient had been taken. There is a folding seat in the back half of the car, and you can sit several people side by side if you turn it over. The rear half of the car is separated from the front cab, and the otherwise clear windows are taped up by a notice, with a wooden panel across the bottom. Dressed in a white hazmat suit and goggles, Sun Xiang Sat in the cockpit with his colleagues, waiting for a new mission. They've made several trips today between the community and the quarantine, the shelter, and the hospital. Police cars are more like ambulances. The whole of Wuhan is like a huge hospital. Many people are waiting for such a car with the door open.

Wuhan "Zero" action began, all levels of patients need to be properly resettled, the community needs all parties linkage.

Xiaozhi (not his real name) is a community worker of Baibu pavilion. "The most difficult time for the Baibu pavilion community was probably when the whole Wuhan epidemic started to break out, " said Xiaozhi, "because there are not many people in the community, there are too many groups, there are too many follow-ups, and the community workers are not medical workers. They have some equipment, expertise in this area, so for them, after the outbreak, they are pushed to the front line. It can be said that apart from the medical workers, they are random doctors. They are not able to cope very well with experience, psychology or materials. Now the community is relatively more organized, there are more beds available than before, the shelter hospitals have been built and the intake of patients is almost complete."

"Don't we have to call the residents every day to find out what's going on? Objectively speaking, we can't guarantee that 120,000 residents will get a phone call every day, " said Xiao Zhi, "people in the community call people, he is very healthy, no one in the family is infected, every day to call him, ask whether the fever today, you ask too much, people will bother you, and then directly say, you do not call me again. Some residents don't want you to come to their homes and check their temperature every day."

It snowed all night on February 15, and Sun Xiang had another busy day.

In the Baibu Pavilion, the entire neighborhood is under police escort. "after the test results come back, we'll sort them. Today only one of the residents was in close contact and the others were suspected of having fever. " The community called the police, who sent a car. "The transfer must be carried out by doctors and police. "

Police travel like doctors, wearing protective clothing, masks and goggles. Before there was no shelter, before the "zero out" operation, their main task was not to transport patients but to patrol and guard against malicious spread. There are a lot of challenges for a community right now, and people haven't been through this kind of extreme testing before. "peace is too long, it's all fun and Games, " Sun Xiang said.

They'll be trained to prevent infection. "We are now more fearful than the average person in case of infection, because we have to bridge the population, don't we? " Sun Xiang said, "I am now living in a dormitory with four people in one room. We can not go home when we are preparing for war. It is the same as the army. We were prepared for war when SARS happened. large-scale activities across the country are also prepared for war. There are countless times. "

Sun Xiang felt the difference this year. Less crime on a daily basis. "Brawling, stealing, mostly gone, " because everyone was at home.

The neighborhood cleaners, social workers are on duty. "Social Management and public services are functioning properly. "

Working at the grassroots level, he added, puts pressure on neighborhood committees and the police. "there is a lot of pressure to do things at the grass-roots level. "

On February 16, Wang Zhonglin, a member of the Standing Committee of the Hubei Provincial Committee and Secretary of the Wuhan Municipal Committee of the Communist Party of China, held a video conference to deploy a dragnet-style investigation, calling for the implementation of five "100 percent" work targets promoted by the Central Guidance Group, we will resolutely curb the spread of the epidemic. The five "100 percent" measures are "100 percent collection of confirmed patients, 100 percent nucleic acid testing of suspected patients, 100 percent testing of Febrile patients, 100 percent isolation of close contacts, 100 percent 24-hour closed management of small villages. ".

Our correspondent sent the news to Sun Xiang and said, you have your work cut out for you. After a long time, he replied, the revolution has not succeeded, comrades still need to work hard.

On February 11, property workers in a residential area in Wuhan distributed vegetables to the owners

Buying vegetables is a big problem

Lu's fresh e commerce platform serves three neighborhoods at the Baibu pavilion, Baibu Huating, Wanjinjiang city and Markham residence. On February 17, the district began to be completely closed. Residents could no longer come to the station to pick up their belongings. After ordering, they would sort and pack them up, and they would transport them to the gate of the district by a small trolley, up to a distance of 200 meters. They would then be carried in by community workers and volunteers, every 20 numbers, in the group called residents downstairs to pick up food.

Lu Jiajun has been busy. In the first week of February, orders exploded and daily turnover rose to twenty thousand. He and his co workers worked until 6 p.m. on three consecutive days, leaving them with no time to drink or eat, and sometimes getting complaints from customers about their inefficiency and stress. "Some employees are emotional, seeing the number of confirmed cases increase by several thousand one day, and they say, 'if it goes up again the next day, I'll quit, and that's when you have to comfort them, ' " he told employees. "We can't control the epidemic. " But as Wuhan people, the only thing you can do at this time is to do your bit. Your relatives and friends in Wuhan, also have to eat. If we don't do it, what will they do. The employees'protective clothing, masks, etc. , they will be complete. She applied for $50 a day per person, doubled wages during the outbreak, and doubled overtime to 1.5 times.

Finally, some employees were left behind, but the manpower was still insufficient. Several part-time employees were recruited, and young people were given priority. They could do manual work, and their resistance was relatively strong. The hourly salary for part-time jobs was adjusted from 25 yuan to 35 yuan, and they worked six to seven hours a day.

At first, LV Jiajun himself also a little afraid, later busy up, "there is no time to fear. "

On February 17, Rong Min's garden was completely closed. From that day on, wechat appeared to buy food group of public interest. Every day from 12:00 noon to 2:00 pm, everyone in the group under the order, the next day at 3:00 pm to the Property Office in the community to get. Vegetables are prepared, a bag of vegetables 50 yuan, there will be Lotus rhizome, cabbage and other four or five kinds of vegetables, ginger and garlic is not available, but some vegetables, "we already thank God. " Once a week, meat, is also a good match, the price is also quite cheap, a bag of less than 200, there are about two catties of chicken breast, two catties of duck, two catties of pork rib, 2.6 catties of spare ribs, unlimited quantity.

Rongmin added more than a dozen groups to buy things, respectively, medicine, fruit, brine vegetables, milk, alcohol, maternal and infant products, see the group she added, can buy as much as possible. "One day at a time, you can't predict what's going to happen tomorrow, you just have to be prepared. "

Do not let out of the community, we can only entrust volunteers, takeout boy, the business distribution agent errands. A total of more than 4,000 households in the community, every day gathered a lot of residents in the delivery gate, waiting for people outside to hand over food and Rice to come in. The door was completely sealed, guarded by volunteers or cadres who had sunk into the community, and anyone who tried to get out would be taken away by the police. Rongmin lives on the 2nd floor, often hear downstairs have old GRANDPA noisy, "don't let me go out. "

Community Workers Xiaozhi, Baibu Pavilion 9 Neighborhood Committees, resident population of 120,000. The situation in Wenhui is even more special, it is the largest low-cost housing site in Wuhan. "At this point, it may be a little more difficult for people living in low-cost housing. "

The community has never been more visible. Mei Hong thinks, this epidemic let everybody"discovered community".

"people often talk about sinking into the community. From the current situation, the community can not be ignored. This time, we see the role of the community itself, and all kinds of difficulties are overcome in the community, " said Mei Hong, "As residents, we are generally afraid, complaining at home, or worrying at home. We see people in the community working very nervously. Community centers, owners'committees and properties are the three most important organizations in China's cities. They are very active in serving you this time, but we also see a lack of normal organization-building. In the construction of organizational relations, different communities show their problems to different degrees. In a sudden situation, it seems that everyone is cooperating with each other, which is not usually seen. At Ordinary Times even contradictory states and conflicting states appear. The State of conflict may be due to the fact that the three parties are different interest groups. The three parties have not done a good job of building each other's institutions. What should I do, what should he do, what can we do together?"

Volunteering can be a step forward. Lin Guang is a volunteer of Wenhui Garden. He began to do voluntary work in Wenhui Garden on February 11. "The opportunity, to be honest, was to replace my wife. " Lin's wife, a party member, wanted to sink into the community as a volunteer. After she was assigned to the pavilion, her 10-year-old son grabbed her mother's hand and said, "I've heard about that place. It's very serious. Can My mother not go? " Lin said, "Why don't I go? She can stay at home and take care of the kids, and I'm sure a man can help. "

Lin Guang had never done before the procurement and distribution of the work, everything from scratch. On the afternoon of his arrival, Lin selected some of the vegetable companies provided by the government and asked them about their strength, the quantity they could provide, whether they had their own base, their transportation capacity, and finally found this one in Huangpi District (a suburb) , it is an hour or two away from Baibu pavilion. There is a base and a chicken farm. The supply should be guaranteed.

Thinking about how to buy and take food, Lin and the volunteers set up a wechat group in the community, through a small program to order and pay, the suppliers of dishes are sold by package, there are 50 a bag and 200 a bag of the difference. The Community Secretary said the neighborhood was demolished by three communities, mostly low income families or people with disabilities, and suggested a 50 yuan price tag. One bag contains 13 catties of vegetables, Chinese cabbage, carrots, potatoes, lettuce, green peppers, plus 30 cents for using a small procedure. "We were worried that residents might not want to pay more fees and were looking for other ways to do it from evening until noon, but it was still the most convenient, " he said. "later, some residents in the group said, "why should we charge 30 cents? "

In the process, he found that at least a third of the residents were elderly, and some groups were mostly sixty, year old residents, who basically had to be taught how to use them by volunteers. Often in the group teach one, the next immediately ask the same question. They were short-handed and recruited six volunteers from the community. Lin Guang is very impressed that the new volunteers are very patient, again and again to teach the old people to use wechat pay and small programs, really will not use each other wechat, let each other transfer money to tell the address, help them order.

On the third day, some residents began to ask in the crowd if there were any black ducks, eggs, meat and fish. A resident said, a week without meat, children noisy. On Feb. 15, Lin contacted a food company in Pak Sha Chau that offered meat packages, 188 yuan each, of lean meat, ribs, chicken breasts, and half a duck. They were in Wuchang District, across the Yangtze River from here, and although they had a source, transportation was difficult, it takes 48 hours to get there.

When the group started ordering meat, residents were so happy that they started with a limit of 100, bought up to 200 in less than half an hour, and finally placed an order of 180. Lin told the manager of the Food Company that night, no, it has to be delivered the next day. The manager was forced to have no way, the next night five or six delivered, Lin Guang and volunteers distribution to 9 pm.

Since early February, Lu's Baibu Kiosk site has been receiving about 500 orders a day. Ninety percent of the orders were for vegetables and meat, and 10 percent were for household items such as rice flour oil, paper towels, and snacks. Daily turnover reached more than 20,000, four times the normal rate. Every day after the line, about 3 to 5 minutes to grab vegetables, 10,000 pieces of meat in a minute or two gone. Baibu pavilion as a result of the epidemic is more serious, may be higher demand. Their small station is only 40-50 square meters, the daily average performance is the highest in Wuhan. "because we were understaffed, we had to be more efficient and serve as a set menu, with five or six vegetables per vegetable set. Individual residents do not understand and complain that we do not provide enough variety of vegetables, but only by reducing the variety of goods, packaging efficiency can be higher, supply capacity can be improved."

In the Baibu pavilion community, workers deliver vegetable food to the supermarket

By Yang Nan

Wait for the inflection point

You Er and his staff, who returned to Wuhan from Leshan, failed to make good on their New Year's Eve dinner. Now, the restaurant more than 20 employees have been arranged in a nearby residential quarters, strict isolation. There was enough stock in the kitchen, and three cooks prepared the food and sent it to them.

Youer's restaurant, which opened in October 2017, is a community-focused restaurant that has always been neighborhood-focused, delivering Zongzi to neighbors during festivals such as the Dragon Boat Festival, and building friendships with many customers who live nearby. They were unable to stay open during the outbreak, but they often brought food to the elderly people left behind in the community.

The damage to the restaurant is self-evident. Kou Tian (not his real name) , a 60-employee farmyard with 11 years of operation near the pavilion, had more than 100,000 items stocked years ago, and lost nearly two hundred thousand per cent of his New Year's Eve dinner income.

Rachel, who works in the garment industry, is worried about job stagnation. "How many companies are now able to pay their employees a basic wage when they're not working? " She said at an offline clothing store. "The boss can't stand it any longer. What can you ask him? Sue Him? No Way. He's lucky to be alive. " Rachel was spending thousands of dollars, even more during the epidemic, and, "there's a mortgage. "

Chengdong also has thirty masks, bought before the outbreak, for the winter. When she went to collect her pass on the 11th, she said, the Neighborhood Committee issued three masks to each family. Individually wrapped, no matter how many people are in a family, there are only three masks in a family. There are only three masks for a family of four.

Now, every time mom goes out to get a dish, Chengdong will worry about it. She would mop the floor with 84 disinfectant and wipe the table with alcohol. There was panic and boredom. "I wanted to go to work, " she said.

Gao Hui is very talkative on the phone. After the daughter had a family, not in her side, the granddaughter childhood and they lived for a period of time, after Middle School back to the parents, "a lot of desolation, moved away we also rest for a while, but the rest is not long, the wife left. "

Sometimes Gao Hui is not well. "I miss my wife, especially when there is only one person in the house. " But she did not move to her daughter's house, "I don't want to leave the pavilion, I don't want to go to them. They're busy, too. The kids are in high school, they don't live in their own house, they rent a place near the school district, and I can't bother them. I'm in good health, I can eat, I can walk, I can talk, I can laugh."My daughter lives an hour away, most of the time it's just a phone call to say, "How's mom? ".

When she was alone at home, she would go to the senior living room in the morning -- a place they liked to call "Totoro" -- to watch TV, chat, or watch a game of mah-jongg, then go home for lunch.

Now "old class" suspended, "happy canteen" is not open, she needs to face more time alone. She would remember the family dinner, the moment she needed to be able to support herself.

After the 10,000 family dinner on January 18, Gao Hui returned home with the "happy canteen" that won the "best creative award" . The dish was kept at home like a bonsai for several days until the ingredients began to spoil and then collapsed. Next, the Baibu Pavilion, Wuhan, Hubei, and many more across the country, suddenly entered life beyond our wildest dreams.

Special topic on "Epidemic Diseases" in war:
